title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on the trenches, particularly offensive linemen and edge rushers.
Draft experts suggest prospects for Patriots: Zion Young (EDGE), Max Iheanachor (OT), and Kenyon Sadiq (TE).
Mike Vrabel's defensive needs influence potential selections, with Young and other edge rushers matching the Patriots' defensive strategies.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey won its first Olympic Gold since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime in Milan.
Jack Hughes scored the winning goal in 3-on-3 overtime, while Connor Hellebuyck made 41 saves for the U.S.
Millis native Matt Boldy opened scoring for Team USA, which ended Canada’s power plays with a perfect defensive record.

title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution suffered a 4-1 defeat to Nashville SC in their 2026 season opener at Geodis Park.
Three key defenders were absent for New England, forcing coach Marko Mitrović to start with a makeshift back line.
Ethan Kohler started over Ilay Feingold at right back, which raised questions after Kohler struggled defensively.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: South Station's new commuter rail fare gates have been closed twice due to harsh winter conditions since opening.
The MBTA spent $3.3 million on these fare gates to curb fare evasion, but faced operational issues in cold weather.
mTicket activations at South Station increased 42% since gate installation, despite environmental challenges causing shutdowns.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime for USA's first Olympic gold in men's hockey since 1980.
Team USA honored Johnny Gaudreau, celebrating with his children on the ice after defeating Canada 2-1.
Boston Bruins players Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman earned gold medals as part of Team USA's victory.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a 368-foot home run in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against the Twins.
Manager Alex Cora praised Monasterio's versatility, noting his potential as the Red Sox' primary platoon infielder in 2026.
Monasterio showed improvement against left-handed pitching in 2025, hitting .273 with an .837 OPS against lefties.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, from Carthage, Maine, was arrested for crashing his truck twice while allegedly on drugs.
Beaulieu faces charges including possession of a class C drug and operating under the influence in Massachusetts.
He was released on personal recognizance and is due in Fall River District Court on March 3.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy of Methuen is searching for her wedding dress after a 15-year mix-up with a dry cleaner.
Dunleavy discovered she had another bride's gown and returned it after identifying the owner through Facebook.
Her missing gown has unique features, including buttons down the back, a flower appliqué, and 'KS' initials in blue.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed a 12-song set at Chevalier Theatre in Medford, highlighting her blend of joy and protest.
At 86, Staples maintained her powerful voice, delivering a mix of vintage songs and socially conscious messages.
Staples shared the stage with her band, featuring her longtime guitarist and opening act Kimaya Diggs with R&B tunes.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The Red Sox are adopting MLB's new ABS system for challenging balls and strikes, with Alex Cora encouraging its use.
Red Sox's Wilson Contreras successfully used the ABS system in spring training, marking the team's first challenge win.
Under the new rules, teams get two challenges per game, retaining them if successful; players, not managers, can initiate.
